titleStmt.title: The Jesuite countermin'd. Or, An account of a new plot carrying on by the Jesuites: manifested by their present endeavours (under all shapes) to raise commotions in the land, by aspersing his Sacred Majesties counsels and actions. Also the reasonableness of modesty in subjects in judging the concerns of their prince.
titleStmt.author: Br., J.
Bradshaw, John, 1602-1659, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: "To the reader" signed: J. Br. [i.e. J. Br., i.e. John Bradshaw?] cf. Wood's Athenae Oxoniensis iv, 619.
Identified at reel 1755:17 as Wing B4152B ("no entry" in Wing 2nd ed., rev.)
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
